reviews.text: My wife and I were coming to DC for the first time (8 nites) and were advised that Crystal City was a good location. Found the Radisson was the best price and only 1 1/2 blocks from the Metro. Great room, nice, with King Sleep number bed (just like home) Microwave and Refrigerator in room w/ freezer. 20 places to eat in a 2 block area along with a convenience store 1/2 block away. Rooms were clean with nice linens, appeared to have been recently updated. Room service was reasonably priced, and prompt (no more that 20 minutes). Neighborhood appears generally upscale and safe looking. A Nice touch was that Gray Line tours picks up at the hotel and returns you after your tour...Metro was just 20 minutes from anywhere we needed to get to. Will stay there again. Advise you ask for a High floor room, we were on 8, and a room at the back of the hotel away from the highway side of the building.

reviews.text: I highly recommend this hotel if you are running the Marine Corp marathon. It is located about 2 blocks from the shuttle pick up and not far from the finish of the race. If you want to take in the sights it is very close to the metro (about 1 block). The rooms were comfortable and the sleep number beds are great. There is nothing fancy about this hotel but they offer decent rates and great service. My only complaint is that the walls are very thin. We could hear the person in the next room on his cell phone talking business most of the early evening. Other than that it was a pleasant stay.
reviews.title: Great location, lack-luster hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were thrilled to find a reasonably priced hotel ($78) in the DC area as we were only spending very little time in our room. The staff were welcoming and the room was very clean and nice. We were very happy with this hotel except with the sleep number beds. We had 2 double beds with two of us sharing a bed. The bed has a hard ridge on the edge which makes it uncomfortable when you sleep near the edge. We just didn't like the air bed feel no matter how we adjusted the bed. I ended up sleeping in the chair 2 nights because I couldn't sleep on this kind of mattress. This hotel has no regular beds (except for handicap) and because of this reason only, we will not return. The bedding and pillows were very nice and the water pressure and temperature was good. We were very happy with this Radisson except for the beds. It is close to great stores and restaurants and they have a shuttle that will drive you to and from close restaurants. The staff went out of their way to help us in any way. I only wish they had regular mattresses.
reviews.title: Loved the hotel - hated the beds
Looks nice, but not!
reviews.text: At first glance, room 720 seemed like a nice room. Then I noticed major stains on the ottoman. The towels were as thin and decrepid as Wal Mart beach towels, two days in a row at 7:00 a.m. there was no hot water. Upon complaining and asking if this was normal, the front desk said they were having problems with it, but it had been fixed. They thought it was a setting on my individual shower control, and all they offered was an apology. My collegue who was on the 5th floor has the same problem. Obviously not the individual shower control. Also, we were there during the daylight savings time change. My collegue unfortunately depended on the hotel's automatic wake-up call system to work. It was never changed for the time change. She was woke up an hour late. She complained. This was three days before we left. It was still not set correctly the day we left. The hotel has a pool. It is outddors. But it is only open during the summer. Ok, fine. At least I can jump in the hot tub, right. WRONG. No hot tub at all. Evidently this hotel just doesn't like hot water. And the gym. HA. No kidding, a room the size of a hotel guest room, with five pieces of equipment. Summarily, this hotel has potential, but even after an extensive recent multimillion dollar remodel, it falls far short of what a DC business traveler expects. Spend your money elsewhere.
